dmca.title: Fwd: [ABUSE] Unauthorized use of Rivals.com Copyrighted Content - Cease and Desist
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Thursday, June 02, 2005 4:45 PM
To: greg@rivals.com
Cc: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Unauthorized use of Rivals.com Copyrighted Content -
Cease and Desist]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being sent to our copyright-related legal counsel at the
address copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Unauthorized use of Rivals.com Copyrighted Content -
Cease        and Desist
Date: Thu, 2 Jun 2005 10:47:19 -0500
From: Greg Gough <greg@rivals.com>
To: texashsftball@yahoo.com, news@texashsfootball.com
CC: counsel@rivals.com, abuse@theplanet.com

Dear Mr. Lyke and owners/publishers of TexasHSFootball.com:

Rivals and Rivals' contracted publishers have published many articles,
photos, videos, and other content (collectively, the "Copyrighted
Works") for inclusion in the company's online and print publications,
including without limitation www.rivals.com and texasprepxtra.rivals.com.
These Copyrighted Works include many interviews of high school recruits and
other content which are published in Rivals' Recruiting Databases and other
publications, all of which are the sole property of Rivals.

As the owner of the Copyrighted Works, Rivals has the exclusive right to,
among other things, reproduce the Copyrighted Works; prepare derivative
works based on the Copyrighted Works; and distribute copies of the
Copyrighted Works to the public in any medium, including via print and
online publications.

It has come to our attention that you continue to cut and paste these
articles and publish them on your message board
(http://www.texashsfootball.com/board/index.php?act=idx).  The most recent
of these posts is located at
http://texashsfootball.com/board/index.php?showtopic=14093.

Rivals has never authorized, licensed, or otherwise granted any of its
exclusive rights under the Copyright Act to you to use the Copyrighted work.
Your unauthorized reproduction, public display, creation of derivative works
and/or distribution of copies or imitations of the Copyrighted Works cause
damage to Rivals and infringe Rivals' exclusive rights under U.S. Copyright
law, including Rivals' right to create derivative works based on the
Copyrighted Works.

Under the Copyright Act, Rivals, as the sole owner of the Copyrighted Works,
may be entitled to recover, at its election: (1) statutory damages; or (2)
the actual damages that it has suffered as a result of your infringement as
well as profits that are attributable to the infringement.  Under the
Copyright Act, a court may award statutory damages of up to $30,000 for
non-willful infringement of a single copyrighted work.  A court may award up
to $150,000 per infringed copyrighted work for willful infringement.
Because you have been warned previously that your actions constitute a
Copyright violation, Rivals believes that you know that Rivals owns the
Copyrighted Works and we consider such infringement to be willful.

In addition, in any action to enforce its copyrights, Rivals may also be
entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees and court costs
associated with the lawsuit as a result of Rivals timely registration of its
copyrights.  See 17 U.S.C.
